definition: to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to bend forward/to lean out

sentences.english: Karen was leaning into the shaft yelling Jack's name.
sentences.chinese: 凱倫朝井內探身，呼喊着傑克的名字。

sentences.english: She leaned forward to scrutinize their faces.
sentences.chinese: 她探身向前，端詳他們的面容。

sentences.english: He reached back carefully and got the pen on the very top of the cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 小心翼翼地往後探身終於拿到了櫥頂的那支筆。

sentences.english: See to it that no children should lean out of the window.
sentences.chinese: 請務必做到不讓孩子們探身窗外。

sentences.english: As the smell wafted up, I climbed out from under my mosquito net and walked softly out of my room.
sentences.chinese: 我從蚊帳裏探身出來，渾身軟綿綿的走出房間。

sentences.english: Mrs Linton bent forward, and listened breathlessly.
sentences.chinese: 林惇夫人向前探身，上氣不接下氣地傾聽着。

definition: to bend over
to lean over/to bend over/to stoop/to bow
to push aside (clothing, curtain etc) to reveal something/to toss aside
to approach/to lean close to
to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
to extend one's head (out or into)/a probe/detector/search unit
at a fast pace
to dodge
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
to leap/to spring/to throw oneself
to visit/to go to see what's going on
sudden big stride forward
backwards/facing back
with a lightning move of the hand
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
